column4: Well, I would like a tip to make a configuration of /etc/fstab file.
Btw, I have installed ntfs-3g and ntfs-config program on my Ubuntu.
I have 3 HDDs in my PC.
That's the file system table of them: http://i125.photobucket.com/albums/p61/avsantos/Ubuntu/Tabeladeparties.png (Arquivos Pessoais = Personal files; "Janelas" = Windows)
(I added a 3rd one last week and it has 40GB (fat32 and /sdc)
I would like to mount, by default, all these others partitions instead of only /sda1, /sda5 (these two were mounted under ntfs-3g configs)
floodbot is a bot, it cannot respond to you.
What does your /etc/fstab look like right now?

You'll need to create mountpoints for each of the partitions you want to mount.  They don't have to be named the same thing as the parition name if you don't want, but heres a little sample as to what it should look like: http://paste.ubuntu.com/39754/
to create mounpoint I need to do: sudo mkdir /media/xxx ?
Yep, a mountpoint is just a fancy name for a directory.
hmm, ok. I'll do it now. But the other 2 HDDs aren't recognized when I mount them by ntfs-3g. What should I do?
They've never been recognized? or just all of a sudden?
/sdb and /sdc are just mounted when I click on them. Every time when I reboot they turn to be unmounted again.
